meanings.definition: The quality or state of being flighty.
meanings.sent1: Her constant flightinesses made it hard to rely on her.
meanings.sent2: The flightinesses of the butterfly captivated the children.
meanings.sent3: The flightinesses of the puppy chasing its tail was both amusing and endearing.
meanings.sent4: The flightinesses of the wind carried the leaves in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The flightinesses of the clouds constantly changing shape mesmerized the onlookers.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be easily distracted or changeable.
meanings.sent1: His flightinesses in class often led to missed assignments.
meanings.sent2: The flightinesses of the squirrel made it challenging to track its movements.
meanings.sent3: The flightinesses of the cat chasing a laser pointer provided endless entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The flightinesses of the river's current carried debris swiftly downstream.
meanings.sent5: The flightinesses of the dancer's movements kept the audience on edge.

meanings.definition: A lack of seriousness or stability.
meanings.sent1: The flightinesses of his promises left her feeling uncertain.
meanings.sent2: The flightinesses of the student's behavior worried the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The flightinesses of the weather forecast made planning a picnic a gamble.
